item.title: Azure Devops CLI - removing old branches after squash merges
item.description: We had a git repo with hundreds of already-merged branches which I wanted to clean up. They’d all been merged via “squash merges”, meaning there was no merge commit to easily link back to the source branches. I wanted to delete these unnecessary branches, but only the ones that had definitely already been merged into the master branch via a pull request (PR). Below is how I used the Azure Devops CLI to get a list of them.
